replies.bodyText:
First of all thanks for your feedback!
I must have missed that point. If such a conversion is wanted we need to take other entities such as participation, submission, result and feedback also into account. They are indirectly attached to the exercise and must be reset on conversion.
I think an import exercise for exam feature would make more sense. Here we would just need to copy the exercise entity, remove the course and add the exerciseGroup.
Such a feature is not part of this PR but we should have a discussion about this.
replies.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: Yes, conversion or such thing would be Priority 2 or even Priority 3.
replies.author: julian-christl

timeline.bodyText: I think that's a fair discussion point. In the one hand if there is an issue during the exam we might want to fix it. On the other hand how do we deal with this in the offline mode? Or do we save on which version of the exercises the student submitted? Do we even have versions of exercises it they get changed?
timeline.author: julian-christl

replies.bodyText:
Honestly I'm not sure if we could reuse this notification functionality for the exam. Do students even see notifications if they are in exam mode?
I don't think Artemis supports versioning of exercises at the moment so this would also require additional work. We should discuss this with the team.
replies.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: I created a meeting page for the next meeting and added this as a discussion point.
replies.author: julian-christl

replies.bodyText: we do not want to support this at the moment. Exercises should not be changed during the exam!
